result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Mace Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.    Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.  May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations.  DE has new charges.  This case is removed from the traffic diversion program and will be heard before the Judge with the new case.   May not have contact with Carl V, Jerald G, Thomas S, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.   May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Mace Jr.

records.addlTxt:
State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber. Attorney Frank J. Parise in court with Defendant Antonio Mace.  Clerk: PU
  Case is resolved.  DE has no objection to proceeding before Judge Gabriele today.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.    Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to DE in court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 100 days in the KCJ forthwith with credit for 92 days.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.
Final pre-trial on September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court will not be available on 8/3/22 so FPT rescheduled to 9/02/22 at 10:00 AM pending confirmation from Atty Parise.
Final pre-trial on August 3, 2022 at 08:45 am.
defense counsel not available the week of July 11th for the FPT.  FPT adj to 8/3/22 @ 8:45AM.  No objection by the State.
from the court re: Judicial Rotation on 8/1/22

Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 09:40 am.
